intro: Timonius branderhorstii, commonly known as the Brandehorst's timonius, is a rare and unique plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It has a compact, bushy habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
